newsitem.title: UK: London SE to list Jiangxi Copper.
newsitem.headline: London SE to list Jiangxi Copper.

text.p: The London Stock Exchange said it will list shares in Chinese mining group Jiangxi Copper Co Ltd.
The issue, the exchange's second Chinese listing, will be brought to the market by Merrill Lynch.
The investment bank has raised 132 million stg through a new issue in Hong Kong and an international placing, the London Stock Exchange said.
Jiangxi Copper is engaged in copper mining, milling, smelting and refining facilities in northeastern Jiangxi province in China.

Tthe listing was made possible by the signing in October 1996, of a memorandum of understanding between the UK and Chinese regulatory authorities, providing Chinese companies with direct access to London markets, the exchange said.

Shares of Jiangxi Copper ended at HK$2.35 on Thursday in Hong Kong on their first day of trading there, against an issue price of HK$2.55. Turnover was 158.04 million shares worth HK$391.26 million, putting it among the 20 most heavily traded stocks by turnover for the day.
"A weak performance had already expected, but the shares falling below the issue price disappointed the market," said Kinson Au, research manager at Asia Financial Securities.

"Investors, particularly in Hong Kong and other Asian countries, know very little about mining stocks and natural resources-related stocks, and that more or less reduced their interest," said Raymond Jook, associate director at SocGen Crosby Securities.
"A deep fall in the (local) stock market also dampened interest," Jook added.
